	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>Dan</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>A great follow up to the Terminator series</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I have been waiting for this movie ever since I first saw T2 many years ago. Now that I have seen it, I can positively say that this was a really good movie and would even enjoyable to the audience that hasn't been longing for this movie as I have. Although this movie was a bit more comical then the previous movies and there is a noticeable difference between this movie and the others because of the absence of James Cameron, it still holds that true Terminator feeling. My only problem with this movie would be the length, barely and hour and a half, which is an half an hour shorter than the spectacular T2. I do suggest this to any terminator or non-terminator fan, you don't need to know every thing about the story to keep you into like some new movies out right now.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>wubbawubba</username>
		<score>0.5</score>
		<shortDescription>Decent action flick...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>...but not worthy as a successor to T2.Great action sequences, big explosions, great chases, and even a little self depricating humor. i liked that. there was only one scene that i felt was overly contrived. overall, it held my attention and kept the adrenaline pumping from start to finish. Arnold looked great.but the plot was average and somehow just wasn't as intelligent as T2. i know I'm not supposed to expect intelligence from an action flick, but i did. The acting was wooden and characters were one sided. I had trouble understanding everyone's motivation. (except for the terminator himself who by definition is one sided, wooden, and motivated). There were also some unexplained idiosyncracies that seemed like the director was going to do something more but then changed his mind. but then at the other extreme, there were some things that were very obvious, but yet were still drilled into us again and again.overall, a good action flick. but I was expecting more.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>AMintKidIcedOver</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Terminator 3 appeals to long time fans and newcomers as well, this was a great movie.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Now im not going to give any of the movie away, because it will not be nearly as good if i do. T3 definitly takes a step up from T2 and T1 in the special effects department. Some of the special effects were absolutely breathtaking. The TX (Lokken)was brilliant as she acted so much like a machine i almost thought that she was! she has very few lines so for most of the movie, she uses facial expressions. She is also very...evil. within the first 20 minutes of the movie she kills quite a few people. Arnold comes back strong as the somewhat primitive Terminator Model-101. Again, like T2 he is greatly at the disadvantage. I think Arnold played the terminator better in T3 then he did in any of the other ones. He seemed a lot more like a machine.As for Nick Stahl playing John Connor, when i first heard that he was replacing Edward Furlong i was really angry. Furlong was the original John Connor, not to mention hes a great actor. He would have been perfect to play Connor again. But i was pleasantly suprised, Nick Stahl played the part great, and you got the feel that he was very nervous, and unstable about judgement day and his destiny from the first moment you saw him. Kathryn Brewster(Claire Danes)is Connors supporting character and Danes does a much better job then i thought she was going to do. All in All, the acting was very well done.The plot had some holes in it but not too bad. I think that they could have cleared a few things up. However, the ending stole the entire movie. I was completely stunned at the end, and it was very unpredictable....i had NO clue it was even coming.All in All, definitly worth the $9.00, maybe another $9.00 if i want to go again.....i urge everyone to go see this movie, it was great8.5/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>txcheng</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>Not a worthy sequel.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>T3 is more of an attempt to simply do a sequel for money. The plot line is fairly convoluted and seems more like the second part in a trilogy.Arnold is simply Arnold. He is okay, the action is as expected, lines seems more forced and the writing is not as witty as T2. Nick Stahl seems more like a TV actor and doesn't have the anger that Eddie Furlong portrayed in T2. Claire Danes does a decent job as his future spouse. Kristanna Loken as T-X is a little confusing as a character and a Terminator. Is she an improvement? She has more mechanical breakdowns than the T-1000 series. She is a babe. She tries to be icy like Robert Patrick did in T2, but to me she needs more training.My major beef about the movie is some obvious script flaws. Claire's father is in charge of an secret Air Force research lab and she along with John Conner and Arnold manage to simply waltz into this facility without even a glitch, loaded with weapons and explosives. Good security, especially in the times we live in now.The other downer is the end. How can the future be written in stone. I find this extremely unbelievable that not one thing all these people do, doesn't appear to change one thing in the future time line.I wish James Cameron was involved with this project. He is a much better writer/director for this type of genre.</fullReview>
	</review>

Again, like T2 he is greatly at the disadvantage. I think Arnold played the terminator better in T3 then he did in any of the other ones. He seemed a lot more like a machine.As for Nick Stahl playing John Connor, when i first heard that he was replacing Edward Furlong i was really angry. Furlong was the original John Connor, not to mention hes a great actor. He would have been perfect to play Connor again. But i was pleasantly suprised, Nick Stahl played the part great, and you got the feel that he was very nervous, and unstable about judgement day and his destiny from the first moment you saw him. Kathryn Brewster(Claire Danes)is Connors supporting character and Danes does a much better job then i thought she was going to do. All in All, the acting was very well done.The plot had some holes in it but not too bad. I think that they could have cleared a few things up. However, the ending stole the entire movie. I was completely stunned at the end, and it was very unpredictable....i had NO clue it was even coming.All in All, definitly worth the $9.00, maybe another $9.00 if i want to go again.....i urge everyone to go see this movie, it was great8.5/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>txcheng</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>Not a worthy sequel.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>T3 is more of an attempt to simply do a sequel for money. The plot line is fairly convoluted and seems more like the second part in a trilogy.Arnold is simply Arnold. He is okay, the action is as expected, lines seems more forced and the writing is not as witty as T2. Nick Stahl seems more like a TV actor and doesn't have the anger that Eddie Furlong portrayed in T2. Claire Danes does a decent job as his future spouse. Kristanna Loken as T-X is a little confusing as a character and a Terminator. Is she an improvement? She has more mechanical breakdowns than the T-1000 series. She is a babe. She tries to be icy like Robert Patrick did in T2, but to me she needs more training.My major beef about the movie is some obvious script flaws. Claire's father is in charge of an secret Air Force research lab and she along with John Conner and Arnold manage to simply waltz into this facility without even a glitch, loaded with weapons and explosives. Good security, especially in the times we live in now.The other downer is the end. How can the future be written in stone. I find this extremely unbelievable that not one thing all these people do, doesn't appear to change one thing in the future time line.I wish James Cameron was involved with this project. He is a much better writer/director for this type of genre.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>adalberto</username>
		<score>1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>AMAZING !!!!!!!!!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I have just experienced the best action scenes I have ever seen. The story is perfect and exceeded by far my expectations.Note: If you have not seen T1 &amp; T2 you will be lost. And if you have, you are going to love this one. Have not seen T3 yet ? What are you waiting for ?</fullReview>
	</review>

		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>dsmith59</username>

		<shortDescription>Great action, tried too hard to come up with a funny line.</shortDescription>

One of the few amusing scenes occurred in the beginning.There's a cliff hanger of an ending, so i'm sure they'll be a T4 in a few years. If you liked the previous terminators, it's worth the price of a ticket.</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>khalsathug</username>
		<score>1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>When I heard they were making another terminator movie, I didn't know what to expect. After seeing this movie though, I was really impressed. I honestly believe this movie is very good. Yes some of the jokes were really lame, like the talk to the hand thing, but many other complaints people have with the movie are unjustified. People have been complaining that Nick Stahl acted "lost" in the movie. Yet that was an element of his character. Even Arnold who's now around 60 was great. Claire Danes who doesn't do many action movies was wonderful in the movie. Not to mention Loken, who is amazing, acted her part pretty well. I'm not arguing that this movie is the best terminator. Yes we all know that Cameron is a great director, but Mostow is one too. The action and story are amazing. People have been complaining about how the movie doesn't require enough thought, but seriously the third time around I think everyone understands the concept by now. There wasn't much need to explain the war. Terminator 2 did that great. This movie is an excellent movie that I believe will make an excellent addition to the terminator series. My only concern is that in order to milk the franchise, future movies will begin to suck. Let's just hope I'm wrong. WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>starman08</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Awesome! Intense ! A must see 4 stars out of 4.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>My wife and I have just seen T3 rise of the machines and we were absolutely blown away by this 3rd installment of the Terminator Saga.At first I had wondered whether the absence of James Cameron as the director would be felt but I can honestly say now, that the T3 story and character development was superbly well done by Jonathan Mostow who has earned my respect as the director of T3.The progression of the events in the film is particularly gripping and intense especially when one understands everything that has led up to the events that take place in T3. All the pieces seem to come together at a whirlwind pace and many questions are answered from the first 2 movies.The action sequences are first-rate, outstanding and compelling. The dynamic interplay and chemistry displayed by the four main characters T101, the TX, John and Kate is fascinating to watch.I highly recommend this film, which is not only non-stop action but also full of emotional depth and eye opening perspectives which characterizes great science fiction stories. I am extremely demanding of science fictions stories having been a hard core Sci-Fi fan all my life and this film passes the test with flying colors.This trilogy will take its rightful place alongside my other favorite Sci-Fi sagas such as the Alien series.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>donj73</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Awesome sequel!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>All I can say is that this movie kicked ass! Probably the best of the 5 summer movies I have seen so far.However, If you guys own the Ultimate Edition DVD of T-2, watching the Special Edition cut with the extra scenes featuring the Sarah Connor character as an old woman will not make this 3rd part make sense.Overall, fantastic sequel....A-....Looking forward to the conclusion.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>odysseia</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>T1 and T2 were Sci-fi landmarks but...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>when treated as a stand alone, T3 is a highly entertaining film.Ah-nold is still doing his thing in a major way. Here's hoping that the storywriters keep the twists and surprising with the indomitable Terminator. Kristanna Loken is a knockout. Her coldness and mercilessness is memorable. Nick Stahl and Clare Danes are engrossing actors. Stahl reminds me of Michael Biehn and Danes of a young Linda Hamilton. All in all, the acting is very good.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>Dan</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>A great follow up to the Terminator series</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I have been waiting for this movie ever since I first saw T2 many years ago. Now that I have seen it, I can positively say that this was a really good movie and would even enjoyable to the audience that hasn't been longing for this movie as I have. Although this movie was a bit more comical then the previous movies and there is a noticeable difference between this movie and the others because of the absence of James Cameron, it still holds that true Terminator feeling. My only problem with this movie would be the length, barely and hour and a half, which is an half an hour shorter than the spectacular T2. I do suggest this to any terminator or non-terminator fan, you don't need to know every thing about the story to keep you into like some new movies out right now.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>wubbawubba</username>
		<score>0.5</score>
		<shortDescription>Decent action flick...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>...but not worthy as a successor to T2.Great action sequences, big explosions, great chases, and even a little self depricating humor. i liked that. there was only one scene that i felt was overly contrived. overall, it held my attention and kept the adrenaline pumping from start to finish. Arnold looked great.but the plot was average and somehow just wasn't as intelligent as T2. i know I'm not supposed to expect intelligence from an action flick, but i did. The acting was wooden and characters were one sided. I had trouble understanding everyone's motivation. (except for the terminator himself who by definition is one sided, wooden, and motivated). There were also some unexplained idiosyncracies that seemed like the director was going to do something more but then changed his mind. but then at the other extreme, there were some things that were very obvious, but yet were still drilled into us again and again.overall, a good action flick. but I was expecting more.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>AMintKidIcedOver</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Terminator 3 appeals to long time fans and newcomers as well, this was a great movie.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Now im not going to give any of the movie away, because it will not be nearly as good if i do. T3 definitly takes a step up from T2 and T1 in the special effects department. Some of the special effects were absolutely breathtaking. The TX (Lokken)was brilliant as she acted so much like a machine i almost thought that she was! she has very few lines so for most of the movie, she uses facial expressions. She is also very...evil. within the first 20 minutes of the movie she kills quite a few people. Arnold comes back strong as the somewhat primitive Terminator Model-101. Again, like T2 he is greatly at the disadvantage. I think Arnold played the terminator better in T3 then he did in any of the other ones. He seemed a lot more like a machine.As for Nick Stahl playing John Connor, when i first heard that he was replacing Edward Furlong i was really angry. Furlong was the original John Connor, not to mention hes a great actor. He would have been perfect to play Connor again. But i was pleasantly suprised, Nick Stahl played the part great, and you got the feel that he was very nervous, and unstable about judgement day and his destiny from the first moment you saw him. Kathryn Brewster(Claire Danes)is Connors supporting character and Danes does a much better job then i thought she was going to do. All in All, the acting was very well done.The plot had some holes in it but not too bad. I think that they could have cleared a few things up. However, the ending stole the entire movie. I was completely stunned at the end, and it was very unpredictable....i had NO clue it was even coming.All in All, definitly worth the $9.00, maybe another $9.00 if i want to go again.....i urge everyone to go see this movie, it was great8.5/10</fullReview>
	</review>

		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>wubbawubba</username>
		<score>0.5</score>
		<shortDescription>Decent action flick...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>...but not worthy as a successor to T2.Great action sequences, big explosions, great chases, and even a little self depricating humor. i liked that. there was only one scene that i felt was overly contrived. overall, it held my attention and kept the adrenaline pumping from start to finish. Arnold looked great.but the plot was average and somehow just wasn't as intelligent as T2. i know I'm not supposed to expect intelligence from an action flick, but i did. The acting was wooden and characters were one sided. I had trouble understanding everyone's motivation. (except for the terminator himself who by definition is one sided, wooden, and motivated). There were also some unexplained idiosyncracies that seemed like the director was going to do something more but then changed his mind. but then at the other extreme, there were some things that were very obvious, but yet were still drilled into us again and again.overall, a good action flick. but I was expecting more.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>AMintKidIcedOver</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Terminator 3 appeals to long time fans and newcomers as well, this was a great movie.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Now im not going to give any of the movie away, because it will not be nearly as good if i do. T3 definitly takes a step up from T2 and T1 in the special effects department. Some of the special effects were absolutely breathtaking. The TX (Lokken)was brilliant as she acted so much like a machine i almost thought that she was! she has very few lines so for most of the movie, she uses facial expressions. She is also very...evil. within the first 20 minutes of the movie she kills quite a few people. Arnold comes back strong as the somewhat primitive Terminator Model-101. Again, like T2 he is greatly at the disadvantage. I think Arnold played the terminator better in T3 then he did in any of the other ones. He seemed a lot more like a machine.As for Nick Stahl playing John Connor, when i first heard that he was replacing Edward Furlong i was really angry. Furlong was the original John Connor, not to mention hes a great actor. He would have been perfect to play Connor again. But i was pleasantly suprised, Nick Stahl played the part great, and you got the feel that he was very nervous, and unstable about judgement day and his destiny from the first moment you saw him. Kathryn Brewster(Claire Danes)is Connors supporting character and Danes does a much better job then i thought she was going to do. All in All, the acting was very well done.The plot had some holes in it but not too bad. I think that they could have cleared a few things up. However, the ending stole the entire movie. I was completely stunned at the end, and it was very unpredictable....i had NO clue it was even coming.All in All, definitly worth the $9.00, maybe another $9.00 if i want to go again.....i urge everyone to go see this movie, it was great8.5/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>txcheng</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>Not a worthy sequel.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>T3 is more of an attempt to simply do a sequel for money. The plot line is fairly convoluted and seems more like the second part in a trilogy.Arnold is simply Arnold. He is okay, the action is as expected, lines seems more forced and the writing is not as witty as T2. Nick Stahl seems more like a TV actor and doesn't have the anger that Eddie Furlong portrayed in T2. Claire Danes does a decent job as his future spouse. Kristanna Loken as T-X is a little confusing as a character and a Terminator. Is she an improvement? She has more mechanical breakdowns than the T-1000 series. She is a babe. She tries to be icy like Robert Patrick did in T2, but to me she needs more training.My major beef about the movie is some obvious script flaws. Claire's father is in charge of an secret Air Force research lab and she along with John Conner and Arnold manage to simply waltz into this facility without even a glitch, loaded with weapons and explosives. Good security, especially in the times we live in now.The other downer is the end. How can the future be written in stone. I find this extremely unbelievable that not one thing all these people do, doesn't appear to change one thing in the future time line.I wish James Cameron was involved with this project. He is a much better writer/director for this type of genre.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>adalberto</username>
		<score>1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>AMAZING !!!!!!!!!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I have just experienced the best action scenes I have ever seen. The story is perfect and exceeded by far my expectations.Note: If you have not seen T1 &amp; T2 you will be lost. And if you have, you are going to love this one. Have not seen T3 yet ? What are you waiting for ?</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>khalsathug</username>
		<score>1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>When I heard they were making another terminator movie, I didn't know what to expect. After seeing this movie though, I was really impressed. I honestly believe this movie is very good. Yes some of the jokes were really lame, like the talk to the hand thing, but many other complaints people have with the movie are unjustified. People have been complaining that Nick Stahl acted "lost" in the movie. Yet that was an element of his character. Even Arnold who's now around 60 was great. Claire Danes who doesn't do many action movies was wonderful in the movie. Not to mention Loken, who is amazing, acted her part pretty well. I'm not arguing that this movie is the best terminator. Yes we all know that Cameron is a great director, but Mostow is one too. The action and story are amazing. People have been complaining about how the movie doesn't require enough thought, but seriously the third time around I think everyone understands the concept by now. There wasn't much need to explain the war. Terminator 2 did that great. This movie is an excellent movie that I believe will make an excellent addition to the terminator series. My only concern is that in order to milk the franchise, future movies will begin to suck. Let's just hope I'm wrong. WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>starman08</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Awesome! Intense ! A must see 4 stars out of 4.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>My wife and I have just seen T3 rise of the machines and we were absolutely blown away by this 3rd installment of the Terminator Saga.At first I had wondered whether the absence of James Cameron as the director would be felt but I can honestly say now, that the T3 story and character development was superbly well done by Jonathan Mostow who has earned my respect as the director of T3.The progression of the events in the film is particularly gripping and intense especially when one understands everything that has led up to the events that take place in T3. All the pieces seem to come together at a whirlwind pace and many questions are answered from the first 2 movies.The action sequences are first-rate, outstanding and compelling. The dynamic interplay and chemistry displayed by the four main characters T101, the TX, John and Kate is fascinating to watch.I highly recommend this film, which is not only non-stop action but also full of emotional depth and eye opening perspectives which characterizes great science fiction stories. I am extremely demanding of science fictions stories having been a hard core Sci-Fi fan all my life and this film passes the test with flying colors.This trilogy will take its rightful place alongside my other favorite Sci-Fi sagas such as the Alien series.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>donj73</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Awesome sequel!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>All I can say is that this movie kicked ass! Probably the best of the 5 summer movies I have seen so far.However, If you guys own the Ultimate Edition DVD of T-2, watching the Special Edition cut with the extra scenes featuring the Sarah Connor character as an old woman will not make this 3rd part make sense.Overall, fantastic sequel....A-....Looking forward to the conclusion.</fullReview>

		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>T1 and T2 were Sci-fi landmarks but...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>when treated as a stand alone, T3 is a highly entertaining film.Ah-nold is still doing his thing in a major way. Here's hoping that the storywriters keep the twists and surprising with the indomitable Terminator. Kristanna Loken is a knockout. Her coldness and mercilessness is memorable. Nick Stahl and Clare Danes are engrossing actors. Stahl reminds me of Michael Biehn and Danes of a young Linda Hamilton. All in all, the acting is very good.</fullReview>

		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>Dan</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>A great follow up to the Terminator series</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I have been waiting for this movie ever since I first saw T2 many years ago. Now that I have seen it, I can positively say that this was a really good movie and would even enjoyable to the audience that hasn't been longing for this movie as I have. Although this movie was a bit more comical then the previous movies and there is a noticeable difference between this movie and the others because of the absence of James Cameron, it still holds that true Terminator feeling. My only problem with this movie would be the length, barely and hour and a half, which is an half an hour shorter than the spectacular T2. I do suggest this to any terminator or non-terminator fan, you don't need to know every thing about the story to keep you into like some new movies out right now.</fullReview>

Probably the best of the 5 summer movies I have seen so far.However, If you guys own the Ultimate Edition DVD of T-2, watching the Special Edition cut with the extra scenes featuring the Sarah Connor character as an old woman will not make this 3rd part make sense.Overall, fantastic sequel....A-....Looking forward to the conclusion.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>odysseia</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>T1 and T2 were Sci-fi landmarks but...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>when treated as a stand alone, T3 is a highly entertaining film.Ah-nold is still doing his thing in a major way. Here's hoping that the storywriters keep the twists and surprising with the indomitable Terminator. Kristanna Loken is a knockout. Her coldness and mercilessness is memorable. Nick Stahl and Clare Danes are engrossing actors. Stahl reminds me of Michael Biehn and Danes of a young Linda Hamilton. All in all, the acting is very good.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-03</date>
		<username>starman08</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Awesome! Intense ! A must see 4 stars out of 4.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>My wife and I have just seen T3 rise of the machines and we were absolutely blown away by this 3rd installment of the Terminator Saga.At first I had wondered whether the absence of James Cameron as the director would be felt but I can honestly say now, that the T3 story and character development was superbly well done by Jonathan Mostow who has earned my respect as the director of T3.The progression of the events in the film is particularly gripping and intense especially when one understands everything that has led up to the events that take place in T3. All the pieces seem to come together at a whirlwind pace and many questions are answered from the first 2 movies.The action sequences are first-rate, outstanding and compelling. The dynamic interplay and chemistry displayed by the four main characters T101, the TX, John and Kate is fascinating to watch.I highly recommend this film, which is not only non-stop action but also full of emotional depth and eye opening perspectives which characterizes great science fiction stories. I am extremely demanding of science fictions stories having been a hard core Sci-Fi fan all my life and this film passes the test with flying colors.This trilogy will take its rightful place alongside my other favorite Sci-Fi sagas such as the Alien series.</fullReview>
	</review>

		<username>superman2k38</username>
		<score>1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>I hope there's more to come!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>This movie if anything left me dying for more Terminator!! Okay, no, it's not art-house, it's not a brainy film, but is it entertaining! Many critics call it a B-Movie. Well, so what. It's fast, fun, and escapist to a hilt. Most critics feel a need to view movies as "art" and critique it on that point. For me, movies are escapism and if they make me forget about the outside world for a couple of hours, they've done their job. Terminator 3 does it wonderfully! The chase scene blows the much-lauded scene from Matrix Reloaded out of the water. Just awesome.Arnold is back, baby!</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>cyberdynesystemsmodel1984</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>very disappointed</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I'm just going to make this short for now because I am very tired. I just came back from seeing the "sneak preview" and I have to say that this movie should have never been greenlit. Most of Arnold's dialogue were horrible but that wasn't the biggest issue of the movie. The main disappointment is the lack of a strong story. With a better director this movie could have been significantly better. T2 had a great story and ended perfectly. The story ended so well that it closed the story preventing the making of a sequel which obviously didn't happen. The ending of the movie doesn't necessarily leave it open for a sequel but there is a chance that there could be. And if there is a sequel I hope I would have the chance to direct it, which I highly doubt. But it is nice to dream. I already have an idea on a possible sequel that would have a strong story and would be able to close the saga. But anyway I do recommend this movie to fans of the previous films so your knowledge may expand on the Terminator universe.</fullReview>
	</review>

		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>Another excellent sequel in the series</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Whereas Terminator 2 was one of the best cinematic sequels ever made, T3: The Rise Of the Machines might be even better. Jonathan Mostow's approach to the story is compelling and mature, Arnold's reappearance is explained cleverly, and the action scenes live up to the precedent set by the first two films. Once again, The Terminator is state-of-the-art.</fullReview>

		<score>0.4</score>
		<shortDescription>Could have been way better</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Don't get me wrong I am a Terminator fan but you got to know when things aren't so good, and this movie wasn't all it was hyped up to be. It had action scenes and what not but no real base line to it story wise. You already know what Terminator is about but there could have been more added to the story line, they explain things well so it wasn't very hard to catch on at all, but it seems like there is something missing not enough effort on this one. The end just leaves you wanting more but not on a good basis. You can obviously tell there will be a forth movie I just hope it will be better than this one hopefully a little more complex not just cheesy wannabe catch phrases and a pair of sun glasses.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>BrokenToasters</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>Falls short of T1, way short of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I went into this movie hoping to be surprised if not downright delighted at what I was seeing. I had hoped that it wouldn't be just another Hollywood big budget sequel that falls short of anything above average. I was, however, very disappointed with what I saw. It was just another Hollywood sequel that had little to add to the first two movies.I was not, however, totally put off by the film. There were some excellent sequences that deserve the proper recognition. The crane chase was creative and entertaining. A few other ideas that I won't mention were good, along with the introduction to skynet, but these were not enough. I didn't feel the same intensity that T2 brought me, or the sense of originality that T1 gave to me.The movie runs short, less than two hours. The dialogue seemed a little cheap. But worst of all, the story was second rate. For as much money as they spent, they could make sure everything is excellent, not just the special effects. If you want nonstop action, by all means see this movie. If you want a thought provoking epic, look elsewhere. 6/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>

Also the action was tamed down to a PG level, What happend to the good old days back in the 80s with the maxium blood gore and vilolence R-Rated all the way. I give this film a 7/10</fullReview>

		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Great time...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I hold T2 in a special place in my heart, as cheesy as that is. I love that movie, and had reservations about this third Terminator movie. Let me assure you though, that this movie is a great time and truly worthy of the Terminator name. The Terminator franchise may be Jimmy Cameron's baby, and T2 is still an amazing film, but this movie takes the series in a great direction, and I look forward to the movie that follows in the footsteps of Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines.</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>NazCaz213</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>a quality summer sequel</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Anyone expecting T3: Rise of the Machines to be the next landmark film in the science fiction genre will be dissapointed. But anyone looking for a quality action movie will not. That's basically what this movie is: a quality movie that doesn't let it's viewers down. We all know that T2 is one of the best action movies of all time and that pedigree makes this movie tough to live up to expectations. But T3 comes through in some ways and doesn't in others. The action is first rate ( I liked the fact there is very little cgi and a lot more real things being blown up), the actors turn in good performances (Arnold pretty much looks as he did in T2), and it makes you want to see T4 (if they make it). The only problems i have with the film are very nitpicky. There is somewhat of a lack of cinematography (it made me miss James Cameron's blue tinted T2), and the Terminatrix is so unbelievably beautiful that it was tough for me to be scared of her. All in all, a pretty satisfying movie with good action, good performances, and some unexpected laughs thrown in. **1/2 stars out of 4</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>

Still though, a VERY good movie compared to some other movies I know, and the T-X character adds most of the action on this film, which makes it a great film! Highly recommend it. 9.4/10 stars.</fullReview>

		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>fun until the end.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>This was a good (not great) movie to just sit and watch. The action was pretty good but I did expect more. I left the movie thinking it was only intermission. The final duel should have been longer and the slapping over the head hinting to another movie takes away form the overall ending. Is T4 already in production?</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>Athlete03</username>
		<score>0.4</score>
		<shortDescription>Could have been way better</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Don't get me wrong I am a Terminator fan but you got to know when things aren't so good, and this movie wasn't all it was hyped up to be. It had action scenes and what not but no real base line to it story wise. You already know what Terminator is about but there could have been more added to the story line, they explain things well so it wasn't very hard to catch on at all, but it seems like there is something missing not enough effort on this one. The end just leaves you wanting more but not on a good basis. You can obviously tell there will be a forth movie I just hope it will be better than this one hopefully a little more complex not just cheesy wannabe catch phrases and a pair of sun glasses.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>BrokenToasters</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>Falls short of T1, way short of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I went into this movie hoping to be surprised if not downright delighted at what I was seeing. I had hoped that it wouldn't be just another Hollywood big budget sequel that falls short of anything above average. I was, however, very disappointed with what I saw. It was just another Hollywood sequel that had little to add to the first two movies.I was not, however, totally put off by the film. There were some excellent sequences that deserve the proper recognition. The crane chase was creative and entertaining. A few other ideas that I won't mention were good, along with the introduction to skynet, but these were not enough. I didn't feel the same intensity that T2 brought me, or the sense of originality that T1 gave to me.The movie runs short, less than two hours. The dialogue seemed a little cheap. But worst of all, the story was second rate. For as much money as they spent, they could make sure everything is excellent, not just the special effects. If you want nonstop action, by all means see this movie. If you want a thought provoking epic, look elsewhere. 6/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>Jason Sousa</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>Overall entertaining, but far from the quality of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I thought the movie kept its traditional sci fi action appeal. However the story was a little weak, there could have been more story lines in between the action. Also the action was tamed down to a PG level, What happend to the good old days back in the 80s with the maxium blood gore and vilolence R-Rated all the way. I give this film a 7/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>g3m3r1c</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Great time...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I hold T2 in a special place in my heart, as cheesy as that is. I love that movie, and had reservations about this third Terminator movie. Let me assure you though, that this movie is a great time and truly worthy of the Terminator name. The Terminator franchise may be Jimmy Cameron's baby, and T2 is still an amazing film, but this movie takes the series in a great direction, and I look forward to the movie that follows in the footsteps of Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>NazCaz213</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>a quality summer sequel</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Anyone expecting T3: Rise of the Machines to be the next landmark film in the science fiction genre will be dissapointed. But anyone looking for a quality action movie will not. That's basically what this movie is: a quality movie that doesn't let it's viewers down. We all know that T2 is one of the best action movies of all time and that pedigree makes this movie tough to live up to expectations. But T3 comes through in some ways and doesn't in others. The action is first rate ( I liked the fact there is very little cgi and a lot more real things being blown up), the actors turn in good performances (Arnold pretty much looks as he did in T2), and it makes you want to see T4 (if they make it). The only problems i have with the film are very nitpicky. There is somewhat of a lack of cinematography (it made me miss James Cameron's blue tinted T2), and the Terminatrix is so unbelievably beautiful that it was tough for me to be scared of her. All in all, a pretty satisfying movie with good action, good performances, and some unexpected laughs thrown in. **1/2 stars out of 4</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>felipeaa90</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Very good summer movie</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I really liked Terminator 3. As a "Terminator" fan, though, it would have been better if James Cameron was still on the scene, and how about killing off Sarah Conner? Still though, a VERY good movie compared to some other movies I know, and the T-X character adds most of the action on this film, which makes it a great film! Highly recommend it. 9.4/10 stars.</fullReview>
	</review>

		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>Rise of the Machines</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I was clueless as what to expect when I went into T3, but when I left, all I could say is wow. In a world where sequels equal crap, T3 is an exception to the rule. With amazing special effects, incredible fight sequences, surprisingly good acting, direction, and story, (and of course the hot hot hot Kristina Loken) this is a summer blockbuster to be reckoned with.</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>lochnessmummy</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>Another excellent sequel in the series</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Whereas Terminator 2 was one of the best cinematic sequels ever made, T3: The Rise Of the Machines might be even better. Jonathan Mostow's approach to the story is compelling and mature, Arnold's reappearance is explained cleverly, and the action scenes live up to the precedent set by the first two films. Once again, The Terminator is state-of-the-art.</fullReview>
	</review>

		<shortDescription>Falls short of T1, way short of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I went into this movie hoping to be surprised if not downright delighted at what I was seeing. I had hoped that it wouldn't be just another Hollywood big budget sequel that falls short of anything above average. I was, however, very disappointed with what I saw. It was just another Hollywood sequel that had little to add to the first two movies.I was not, however, totally put off by the film. There were some excellent sequences that deserve the proper recognition. The crane chase was creative and entertaining. A few other ideas that I won't mention were good, along with the introduction to skynet, but these were not enough. I didn't feel the same intensity that T2 brought me, or the sense of originality that T1 gave to me.The movie runs short, less than two hours. The dialogue seemed a little cheap. But worst of all, the story was second rate. For as much money as they spent, they could make sure everything is excellent, not just the special effects. If you want nonstop action, by all means see this movie. If you want a thought provoking epic, look elsewhere. 6/10</fullReview>

		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>Rise of the Machines</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I was clueless as what to expect when I went into T3, but when I left, all I could say is wow. In a world where sequels equal crap, T3 is an exception to the rule. With amazing special effects, incredible fight sequences, surprisingly good acting, direction, and story, (and of course the hot hot hot Kristina Loken) this is a summer blockbuster to be reckoned with.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>lochnessmummy</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>Another excellent sequel in the series</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Whereas Terminator 2 was one of the best cinematic sequels ever made, T3: The Rise Of the Machines might be even better. Jonathan Mostow's approach to the story is compelling and mature, Arnold's reappearance is explained cleverly, and the action scenes live up to the precedent set by the first two films. Once again, The Terminator is state-of-the-art.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>

		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>Athlete03</username>
		<score>0.4</score>
		<shortDescription>Could have been way better</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Don't get me wrong I am a Terminator fan but you got to know when things aren't so good, and this movie wasn't all it was hyped up to be. It had action scenes and what not but no real base line to it story wise. You already know what Terminator is about but there could have been more added to the story line, they explain things well so it wasn't very hard to catch on at all, but it seems like there is something missing not enough effort on this one. The end just leaves you wanting more but not on a good basis. You can obviously tell there will be a forth movie I just hope it will be better than this one hopefully a little more complex not just cheesy wannabe catch phrases and a pair of sun glasses.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>BrokenToasters</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>Falls short of T1, way short of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I went into this movie hoping to be surprised if not downright delighted at what I was seeing. I had hoped that it wouldn't be just another Hollywood big budget sequel that falls short of anything above average. I was, however, very disappointed with what I saw. It was just another Hollywood sequel that had little to add to the first two movies.I was not, however, totally put off by the film. There were some excellent sequences that deserve the proper recognition. The crane chase was creative and entertaining. A few other ideas that I won't mention were good, along with the introduction to skynet, but these were not enough. I didn't feel the same intensity that T2 brought me, or the sense of originality that T1 gave to me.The movie runs short, less than two hours. The dialogue seemed a little cheap. But worst of all, the story was second rate. For as much money as they spent, they could make sure everything is excellent, not just the special effects. If you want nonstop action, by all means see this movie. If you want a thought provoking epic, look elsewhere. 6/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>Jason Sousa</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>Overall entertaining, but far from the quality of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I thought the movie kept its traditional sci fi action appeal. However the story was a little weak, there could have been more story lines in between the action. Also the action was tamed down to a PG level, What happend to the good old days back in the 80s with the maxium blood gore and vilolence R-Rated all the way. I give this film a 7/10</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>g3m3r1c</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Great time...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I hold T2 in a special place in my heart, as cheesy as that is. I love that movie, and had reservations about this third Terminator movie. Let me assure you though, that this movie is a great time and truly worthy of the Terminator name. The Terminator franchise may be Jimmy Cameron's baby, and T2 is still an amazing film, but this movie takes the series in a great direction, and I look forward to the movie that follows in the footsteps of Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>NazCaz213</username>
		<score>0.7</score>
		<shortDescription>a quality summer sequel</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Anyone expecting T3: Rise of the Machines to be the next landmark film in the science fiction genre will be dissapointed. But anyone looking for a quality action movie will not. That's basically what this movie is: a quality movie that doesn't let it's viewers down. We all know that T2 is one of the best action movies of all time and that pedigree makes this movie tough to live up to expectations. But T3 comes through in some ways and doesn't in others. The action is first rate ( I liked the fact there is very little cgi and a lot more real things being blown up), the actors turn in good performances (Arnold pretty much looks as he did in T2), and it makes you want to see T4 (if they make it). The only problems i have with the film are very nitpicky. There is somewhat of a lack of cinematography (it made me miss James Cameron's blue tinted T2), and the Terminatrix is so unbelievably beautiful that it was tough for me to be scared of her. All in all, a pretty satisfying movie with good action, good performances, and some unexpected laughs thrown in. **1/2 stars out of 4</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>felipeaa90</username>
		<score>0.9</score>
		<shortDescription>Very good summer movie</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I really liked Terminator 3. As a "Terminator" fan, though, it would have been better if James Cameron was still on the scene, and how about killing off Sarah Conner? Still though, a VERY good movie compared to some other movies I know, and the T-X character adds most of the action on this film, which makes it a great film! Highly recommend it. 9.4/10 stars.</fullReview>

		<username>BrokenToasters</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>Falls short of T1, way short of T2</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I went into this movie hoping to be surprised if not downright delighted at what I was seeing. I had hoped that it wouldn't be just another Hollywood big budget sequel that falls short of anything above average. I was, however, very disappointed with what I saw. It was just another Hollywood sequel that had little to add to the first two movies.I was not, however, totally put off by the film. There were some excellent sequences that deserve the proper recognition. The crane chase was creative and entertaining. A few other ideas that I won't mention were good, along with the introduction to skynet, but these were not enough. I didn't feel the same intensity that T2 brought me, or the sense of originality that T1 gave to me.The movie runs short, less than two hours. The dialogue seemed a little cheap. But worst of all, the story was second rate. For as much money as they spent, they could make sure everything is excellent, not just the special effects. If you want nonstop action, by all means see this movie. If you want a thought provoking epic, look elsewhere. 6/10</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>BKT900</username>
		<score>0.5</score>
		<shortDescription>WOW!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Ii have waited for this film for years, and let me tell you, it was worth the wait. The first time i watched T3, i came out with mixed feelings because all the scenes that i really wanted to see in the film were missing. I was really looking forward to seeing the CRS build T-1s and T-600/800 endoskeletons. Most of all, i wanted to see Chief Master Sergeant William Candy. When i watched the movie, i saw that many scenes were cut out. So, when i watched T3 for the second time, I LOVED IT. Things just fit together perfectly. T3 is definitely my favorite of the trilogy. IMO, it told the coolest story out of the three. We finally see Skynet's rise to power. Also, the story had heart and it had a soul. T3 was basically John Connor's story. At the beginning of the film, he is a slacker who wants no part of his destiny. At the end of the film, he finally accepts his fate as the leader of the human race. Nick Stahl gave a fantastic performance as John Connor, he made you care for the character and he actually made the character's inner emotional struggle throughout the film believable. Claire Danes was excellent as Kate Brewster. Kate is very much like the Sarah Connor of the first film. She is an innocent woman who is suddenly taken away from her life and put into a world full of terror and death. Kate is very important to the plot of the film and to the terminator story as a whole. Arnold is perfect as The Terminator, what else can i say? Kristanna Loken gave a great performance as the T-X. IMO, she was just as terrifying and menacing as Robert Patrick's T-1000. The rest of the cast does a fine job as well. The humor worked fine IMO, it was very similar to T2 in this aspect. The humor comes at the right time. To all the naysayers, this IS NOT a remake or a rehash of T2. It is a worthy continuation of the terminator story full of new and fresh ideas. The ending of the film is just awesome. Its probably the best ending in years. Same goes for the action and special effects. Stan Winston and ILM did an excellent job. Kudos to Jonathan Mostow to staying true to T-1 and T2 and giving us a terrific third installment. Hopefully, he will return for T4, which will be the full future war film. 10/10</fullReview>
	</review>

		<username>Sora07</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>Better than expected</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>When I went to go see T3 today, I wasn't expecting much. This was forthree reasons:1) Its a modern day sequel based on great classic movies, and most modern sequels suck. 2) It wasn't directed or written by James Cameron. 3) How the hell could the story fit?! IT ENDED IN T2!So, I went in with not expecting much. God I was wrong. While it isn't as good as THE TERMINATOR or its sequel TERMINATOR 2: JUDGMENT DAY, I say it was very entertaining. The action sequences were good, and the story fit well into the existing time line. The acting was also very good. I was kind of disappointed that Edward Furlong didn't come back to play John Connor, and I was really hoping for a cameo of Linda Hamilton's Sarah Connor and Michael Biehn's Kyle Reese (I know he is dead, but he did make a cameo in T2, just watch the deleted scenes on the T2 Extreme DVD), but we can't have everything now, can we? I was also pleased that there were some very funny inside jokes to us Terminator fans.Also, the T-X was a pretty good ruthless villain, even though she will never compare to Robert Patrick's T-1000 or Arnold's original T-101. The movie also, of course, sets up for a sequel which will be very interesting (I'd tell you why, but then it would ruin the ending).Overall, it was pretty entertaining and better than expected.</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>legendoffrez</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>Rise of the dollar</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>When compared to the first and second Terminator movies, T3 is probably average at best.The special effects were top notch but the movie seemed forced. Whereas the first and second at times grew deep and philosophical (or as much as this storyline would allow), T3 had none of that. It was just action scenes mixed in with ho-hum dialogue to explain what was about to happen next.Terminator 2 technically was a sequel, but it didn't *feel* like a sequel. T2 could have stood on its own.Terminator 3, on the other hand, pretty much assumes that the viewer is familiar with the storyline. Old characters (just one really) are shamelessly plugged in for quick appearances that didn't further the storyline one bit. New characters have been added and their histories faked to appear as if they've always been a part of the Terminator world. The movie watched as if it was the last season of some long running television series overdue for retirement.On the plus side, T3 has some strengths. As mentioned earlier, the special effects were excellent. Also, the writers gave the Terminator some hilarious moments.This is a short movie and the action moves briskly. Watch it if you're a fan of the series or if you're into awesome action scenes, but don't expect it to be very deep. 6 out of 10.</fullReview>
	</review>

		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>jrat6200 (jrat6200@yahoo.com)</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>If you can do it once, twice, go ahead and do it AGAIN!!!</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Before seeing this movie, there wasn't a lot of promoting going on and I'm disappointed with that matter. Everybody's upset because James Cameron didn't put his two cents into the movie. Well, WHO CARES!!! This is what I call a movie. It's been a long time since I've seen a good movie. Especially since this is an anticipated one. I've been longing to see Arnold back with a machine gun in his hand or whatever arsenal he can equip himself with as the lethal and clever terminator. I loved this movie. It beats all the other movies for the summer. Rated R action shows hardcore here. Forget what the critics say about this movie. Terminator 3 lived up to its name. If they didn't like this 3rd one then they can forget about liking the whole series all together.Jonathan Mostow did a great job. He took on a big project that I think all other directors would have been scared to do. If I saw him in person I'd congratulate him on a job well done. I love the terminator series. I forgot he did U-571. In my opinion Cameron missed out. I don't care if he didn't direct. It's time for somebody to try something new.Even though this movie costs 175 million to make, it doesn't matter. The action made up for it. The special effects was the best I've seen in a while. THANKS STAN WINSTON!!! I'm proud of that. I'm a martial arts movie maniac. There wasn't martial arts in it, and that just it, old fashioned beat 'em up style (thrown through walls, slammed, etc.) The humor was great too. Only thing that was off was the father of Claire Danes's character. He didn't seem to emotional when he thought she was killed. Oh well, still great movie. Can't wait for the dvd to come out. Last thing, Kristanna Loken did great as the villian and sexy too. GO SEE IT EVERYBODY!!!!</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-02</date>
		<username>BenWydeven</username>
		<score>0.6</score>
		<shortDescription>*SPOILERS* No James Cameron? Don't let it discourage you. **</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I went to Terminator 3 with skepticism, having enjoyed watching T2 over and over as a kid (I'm 22). The thing that really bugged me initially about Terminator 3 before I entered the theater, was that there was no Linda Hamilton and no Edward Furlong.No James Cameron too direct!?How good can it be??Having just seen Terminator 3 a little over an hour ago, I can't remember the last time I was blown away by a movie. Arnold is still as cool as ever, reprising his breakthrough role with more stunts that you can expect a 54 year old body builder to take on. The Terminatrix is great and Kristanna Loken takes the role with artificial intelligence written all over her. Nick Stahl has the John Connor role down to a T. The Kate Brewster character had to sink in for a while, but the chemistry between her and Connor is comparable to that of Kyle and Sarah.However, if you know and love the first two films like I do, you can only get so much out of the third act. It has all the action and explosions that you can expect from a summer action thriller. But there lacks the storytelling that James Cameron was known to carefully mesh into breathtaking action and effects. Without the powerful story telling of James Cameron, this movie is really just about getting away from the bad guy and stopping the inevitable nuclear war. I loved seeing prototypes of the Skynet computers come to life, reconizing them from the first two movies. I was even taken by Kate Brewster's connection to John Connor and events preceding Terminator 2 and the way they hate each other upon knowing they will one day be married. But despite the cleverness, familiarity and even the disturbing nuclear fear that John Mostow brings to the series I struggle to come to the conclusion that Terminator 3: The Rise of the Machines is just a way to bring back a loved character. I wish it (the story telling NOT the action) had been better. ** out of 4.</fullReview>
	</review>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-01</date>
		<username>BNP</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>A Very Worthy Sequel</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>I can't believe it. After five years of reading through rumours and gossip, it has finally been unleashed. After a year of antcipating this movie and watching the previews over and over again "it is time". Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines is here, and holy crap did come in style.This movie blows all of the other summer movies away.Before I go on, I must say this; MINOR SPOILERS (nothing drastic) will be given away.The movie opens with John Connor now in his 20's. He's living off the radar, and moves around a lot. He sort of a has been now. Since they stopped Judgment Day from happening ten years previous, he has nothing to live for really. However, he's still paranoid and never forgets what his mom taught him. But now another, highly advanced terminator (Kristana Loken) has been sent back to, well, terminate him. The T-X, as it's called, goes around and kills all of John's future Lieutenants. The T-X also goes after a girl named Kate Brewster (Claire Daines) who we find out has a very important role in the future war. The Human Resistance was able to send back another Terminator (Schwarzenegger) to protect Connor and Brewster. But which one will reach him first?Now, I'll get to the good stuff in awhile but first I want to mention the casting. The casting of Nick Stahl as Connor was great. I first saw Stahl in the Mel Gibson directed movie The Man With-out A Face. Then Stahl was just a kid, but he did a great job in the role he played. Stahl replaces Edward Furlong in the role of Connor and he does a great job at it. His performance is brilliant and the way he captures the character of a guy who knows that the world could be destroyed at anytime is excellent.The casting of Claire Daines as Kate Brewster was a smart move as well. I can't actually think of any other actress who would fit in this role. As much as I like Natalie Portman, I don't think she would have been believable in this role, and it would have just been her doing her Star Wars bit again. Daines and Stahl have some great chemistry on screen together and that really helps the movie. That's one thing that can always hurt a movie if people are supposed to like each other. Bad chemistry is noticeable, and it distracts from the picture.Now onto the choice role of the T-X, Kristana Loken. While she doesn't play the character as menacing as Robert Patrick's T-1000 character in T2, she does do a good job, at being the, sort of, innocent cute girl. She actually surprised me and did a good job. She's not a scary character, which is a shame, but she's a tough one. I wasn't to keen on the idea of a female terminator, I though it would be handled wrong, but I was wrong. I suppose that's what I get for under-estimating Jonathan Mostow, who did good job with this movie.Sure T3 isn't as good as the first two. I didn't expect it to be, and it doesn't bother me. First of all, it's a different director and writers. The James Cameron Terminator movies are far superior to this one, but this one is still a worthy sequel.Mostow, who directed the great Kurt Russell thriller 'Breakdown' and the tense submarine thriller 'U-571', handles this movie really well. He pays homage to the original Terminator movies as well as adding his own spin on it.This one isn't as 'dark' as the other ones were, but it still works. I have said for awhile now, that this movie will either crush Mostow's career, or give him the respect he deserves. And it looks like I'm right.Mostow has an eye for action, and a well placed eye that is. Most of the action in this movie is way better than most of the other action in any of the previous summer action movies.And another good thing is it never lets up. The action just keeps coming. What a thrill ride. The massive car chase near the beginning was brilliant. I said the Matrix: Reloaded car chase was good, but this one is far better, mainly because it uses REAL cars and real stunts. It doesn't rely on CGI to make explosions and cars crash.The first car chase, or rather truck chase, is fun and thrilling. It involves a crane truck and Arnie chasing the T-X on a police motorcycle. It's too much to talk about it, but it's great. What I also liked about this chase was something very subtle. The chase started a night, but it ended during the day. I loved the fact that Mostow decided to have the sun come up during the chase. I don't know why. Probably because most car chases either happen during the day or night, never in between. It was a nice touch. Lame I know, but I liked it.The rest of the action is skillfully done and it was some neat stuff to see. A fight between the Terminator and the T-X had me worried for a minute that Woman's Rights Activists might sue the studio because of the beating Arnie gives the female T-X. But then she fought back, so I guess it evens the score.Also, I must mention Stan Winston. He worked on the previous two Terminators and even won an Academy Award for make-up and special effects on T2. He returns here, and does a stellar job. I love seeing the battle damage on the Terminator, with the Terminator skeleton popping out and flesh still hanging on. It's really neat make-up and job well done. I think another Academy Award might in sights for Winston.Now there was a lot of humour in this one. I laughed at a lot of it, and it was nice to kind of see Arnie play around and make fun of himself on screen. Like just after he gets his outfit and what he does. It was stupid, but I will admit, I laughed. It was harmless, but it could have done with-out it.Now, there were some things that I didn't like about T3. Yes, I know, hard to believe, eh? I didn't like some of the dialogue. It was weak at times, but all the goodness about this movie makes up for all the bad.I also didn't like the fact the classic Terminator theme was absent through out the whole movie. Now Marco Beltrami did a god job composing the movie. The soundtrack was great, it's just, I missed that Terminator theme. It's such an awsome theme, how could he not use it? Sure it appears in the end credits, but still?The story moves along at break neck pace and keeps rolling and rolling. The movie does slow down from time to time to explain things and further the story as well. I don't want to say anything about the story in general, but what I will say is that it's pretty good.In Roger Ebert's review he said `The ending must remain for you to discover, but I will say it seems perfunctory'. I disagree. I liked the ending. As did Ebert's reviewing buddy Richard Roeper. It does leave questions out there, but it also seems to say that, no matter how much we try, we are always doomed. You can't stop something from happening that's supposed to happen, you can only postpone it, and wait until it arrives to do what your fate has chosen for you to do.The ending was good. I liked it. I don't care what anyone says about it, it was good.So, now my closing comments, Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines is a summer action movie that delivers. It doesn't have a complicated storyline that makes you stop paying attention and makes you just want to leave the theatre so bad (Matrix Reloaded). It doesn't rely heavily on CGI like the Matrix did, and when it has CGI, its damn good. It's not as noticeable or poorly done like the Matrix and Hulk were. It also has non-stop great action.It's a great movie and I know I've said this before, but I recommend seeing this. Go buy a ticket, buy some popcorn sit down and enjoy the lame, but fun, humour, the action and spectacular visuals.I have to say it, but Arnold is back everyone, and he's back in full force. Terminator 3 is here, and now its time for King Conan.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-01</date>
		<username>bytor-5</username>
		<score>0.8</score>
		<shortDescription>The tradition of great SFX continues</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>The latest installment of the Terminator movies will not only thrill fans, but also impress the casual viewer. Time isn't wasted on useless sentimentality as this movie kicks into action from the very beginning. Schwarzenegger reprises his role to perfection and thankfully keeps the cheesy one-liners to a minimum.Although it is noticeably missing the James Cameron touch, director Jonathan Mostow certainly delivers a quality picture worthy of becoming part of the trilogy. Some bad acting and poor writing hinder this from being a perfect film, but that was almost to be expected. Still, experience T3 on the big screen along with great sound, and you won't be disappointed.</fullReview>
	</review>

		<date>2003-07-01</date>
		<username>RedlightKittens</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Just garbage...</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Spoilers Warning...Terminator 3 defies logic on so many levels. First of all, I have the same initial question with T-3 that I did with T-2. Why on earth does the future John Connor (or military personnel) continue to send old, obsolete model cyborgs to save him in the past? Wouldn't it make sense to send the same updated, slicker model that was sent to kill him? And why does the female T-X pump up her clevage to flirt with a cop? Isn't she the Terminator?? Why does she need tricks to get his gun? Just take it like you do everything else! Speaking of the cop's gun, why does she even need a gun? Her arm can shape into a gun, a rocket launcher, and a flame thrower. And why does she need to taste a bloody woman and bloody gauze pad to identify people? Isn't her tongue made from the same synthetic material her finger is? She should taste it as soon as she sticks her finger in it. She also murders a guy in a drive thru burger joint, but the window is on the right hand side. Why? Isn't this America?? And what happened to her mission to destroy John Connor's future lieutenants? She abandons that idea early on and decides to pursue John Connor and his future wife for the duration of the movie.T-3 is a poor movie with a convoluted plot, uneven pacing and boring action. The ending is anti-climatic and the film in general feels small and incomplete. It ends with a door open for a sequel, but I am not looking forward to it. T-3 is simply garbage.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-01</date>
		<username>shkspr</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Lots of good action but disappointing story</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>There was much room for improvement in the third installment of the series. I enjoyed the action just as I would have expected but the new John Conner, Nick Stahl and Kate Brewster, Claire Danes do not have much screen presence for these roles.The one liners and references to the previous films are very good and are enough to keep it interesting. I noticed that the audience did not catch many of the references and wondered if the humor was only there for the die-hard fans. Overall I would say go to a matinee instead of paying full price.</fullReview>
	</review>
	<review>
		<date>2003-07-01</date>

		<username>DunnDeeDaGreat</username>
		<score>-1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Two words sum up this movie for me and they are popcorn flick</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>Moviegoing auidences have been waiting twelve years for Arnold Schwarzenegger to come back to the role that made him famous and the question remains; was it worth the wait? For me the answer is yes and no. First I'll focus on the yes part of the movie. Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines delivers it's share of action and special effects which in the summer time is why we go to the movies. Nick Stahl whose is a very talented actor takes the role of John Connor from Edward Furlong and does it well. And the T-X played by the sexy Kristanna Loken is meancing and a smooth bad ass bad guy. Fianlnly Jonathan Mostow handles the action sequences very well in the film. The chase sequence in the film is one of the best I've seen from the three movies he's directed . Now let's focus on the no part of Terminator 3 that will upset many moviegoers. Terminator 3 has two main probelms that makes the film pale in comparison to it's precassadors. The first being the lack of storytelling that trio of screenwriters John Brancato,Michael Ferris and Tedi Sarafian can't seem to capture that Cameron magic which affects the direction of the talented Mostow. The second problem is the familar score by composer Brad Fiedel which is gone from this film. When it comes to the females in the film Claire Danes and Kristanna Loken both kinda gives a paper thin performances. Danes over does the damsel in distress role and Loken is nothing more than eye candy (but damn does she look good). The film won't please all tastes but if you want mindless entertainment then check this one out. Hopefully the inevitable Terminator 4 with Nick Stahl in the lead will be an improvement over this one. It's not that Terminator 3 is a bad film it just wasn't worth a 12 year wait. Mt final verdict on the film is ** 1/2 stars.</fullReview>

	<review>
		<date>2003-07-01</date>
		<username>darth_tyranus</username>
		<score>1.0</score>
		<shortDescription>Awesome.</shortDescription>
		<fullReview>*Spoliers* I just got back from seeing T3 tonight. At first I was not sure whether I really loved it or I really hated it. I have since decided on the former. I went into the movie with a very hopeful yet skeptical attitude. Ok, the movie. At first I was afraid that my fears were coming true (the stupid sunglasses, talk to the hand - which actually was incredibly funny to me). The T-X made me quite sketical at first because she is so hot that I could not think of her being a mean ass. Then when she connects to the net through her phone I thought "oh d*mn." From then on out she is a bad*ss. The chase through LA is hands down awesome. Much better than the Matrix Reloaded chase (though not as long). The Terminator is very good. If a little more emotive than he should be. Things about the movie that I really loved: Skynet coming online was so cool. There really wasnt much to it, but just knowing that it was happening was so cool. Conner realizing that judgement day cannot be averted was very good. I also liked how the machines came to realize that just as judgement day itself could not be avoided, neither could John Conner, so instead they aim at the less important parts in an attempt to lessen the sum - the future generals that serve under Conner. At first I did not like how the movie ended, with the bombs dropping right at the end. But in retrospect I think it was good that way. However, it also necessitates another sequel. I was sorta hoping for some closure. But I was also itching to see everything blow up. Which also did not really happen. But I guess that really was not all that necessary. There were a few other bad things. First of all, there was just a little too much corny humor. Some would have been good, but not as much as was in there. The sarah conner part was rather lame, in my opinion. I wish they would have explained some more how the main players all happened to find there way together at the kennel. The movie sorta throws out the whole "no fate but what we make" thing. However, I think that is a good thing though. Lastly, I was hoping that Mostow would throw in something about Uncle Bobs left over arm at the end of T2. All that being said, I am very pleased with this movie. 9 out of 10.</fullReview>
	</review>
